Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World

  • public class World
extends Object
    This class represents the two-dimensional world during a Darwin simulation. Each position of the world may be populated either by nothing or by a single creature.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int width, int height)
      Create a new world consisting of width columns and height rows.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Creature get(Position pos)
      Get the creature at the given position of the board, or null if no creature occupies that position.
      int height()
      Get the height of the world.
      boolean inBounds(Position pos)
      Check whether the given position is within the bounds of the world (i.e., its x and y coordinates specify a valid world position).
      static void main(String[] args)
      Tests the functionality of the World class.
      Position randomPosition()
      Get a random position within the bounds of the world.
      void set(Position pos, Creature creature)
      Update the given world position to contain the given creature (which may be null, in which case the world position is cleared).
      int width()
      Get the width of the world.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int width,
             int height)
        Create a new world consisting of width columns and height rows. Initially, the world contains no creatures.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the world.
        height - The height of the world.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Creature get(Position pos)
        Get the creature at the given position of the board, or null if no creature occupies that position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to get.
        Returns:
        The creature at the specified position, or null.

      • height

        public int height()
        Get the height of the world.
        Returns:
        The world height.

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds(Position pos)
        Check whether the given position is within the bounds of the world (i.e., its x and y coordinates specify a valid world position).
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the given position is within the world bounds.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Tests the functionality of the World class.

      • randomPosition

        public Position randomPosition()
        Get a random position within the bounds of the world. All valid world positions (occupied or not) are returned with equal probability.
        Returns:
        A random position within the world.

      • set

        public void set(Position pos,
                Creature creature)
        Update the given world position to contain the given creature (which may be null, in which case the world position is cleared).
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to update.
        creature - The creature to place at the given position, or null.

      • width

        public int width()
        Get the width of the world.
        Returns:
        The world width.
